title: Mount Edwards (Queensland)
text:
Mount Edwards is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in <a href="South%20East%20Queensland">South East Queensland</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. The mountain rises above sea level and is part of the <a href="Moogerah%20Peaks%20National%20Park">Moogerah Peaks National Park</a>. It lies within its namesake <a href="Suburbs%20and%20localities%20%28Australia%29">locality</a> <a href="Mount%20Edwards%2C%20Queensland">Mount Edwards</a>, approximately 100 km south west of <a href="Brisbane">Brisbane</a> approximately 17 km (10.5 mi) from the town of <a href="Boonah">Boonah</a>. The mountain is the closest of the Moogerah Peaks to the <a href="Cunningham%20Highway">Cunningham Highway</a> and is 9 km south of <a href="Aratula%2C%20Queensland">Aratula</a>. Other prominent peaks in this <a href="Scenic%20Rim">Scenic Rim</a> group of mountains includes <a href="Mount%20French%20%28Queensland%29">Mount French</a>, <a href="Mount%20Moon">Mount Moon</a> and <a href="Mount%20Greville">Mount Greville</a>.
Explorer <a href="John%20Oxley">John Oxley</a> named the mountain Mount Banister in 1824. Later renamed in 1828 by Alan Cunningham after Lieutenant George Edwards.
The Indigenous name, given by the <a href="Yugara">Yugara</a> people, is Wummun.
The summit is accessed by walking track that starts across the <a href="Moogerah%20Dam">Moogerah Dam</a> wall. The 2.7 km walk to the top affords views across <a href="Fassifern%20Valley">Fassifern Valley</a>.
Between Mount Edwards and Little Mount Edwards (363 m) to the east, is Reynolds Creek which flows through a steeply sloped <a href="gorge">gorge</a>.
